intro: Chomelia dimorpha, commonly known as the two-form chomelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural collections.
